subject: JUnit Recipes
msgSnippet: I got my copy on Friday and I have to say that JUnit Recipes is an awesome book! (I even stopped reading Dan Brown s Da Vinci Code for a while :-). I love
messageBody:
I got my copy on Friday and I have to say that "JUnit Recipes" is an awesome
book! (I even stopped reading Dan Brown's Da Vinci Code for a while :-). I love
the way that each recipe is presented. It is very clear and concise. There are
loads of good ideas and techniques in each recipe. Even something as simple as
testing getters/setters provides important information and discussion from
various angles. It is very good to see different opinions of the industry about
the treated subjects laid out properly and objectively. I can't wait to find
some time to read more...

J.B. Thanks for such a valuable resource. "JUnit Recipes" certainly has its
place at the top of my library, next to GoF's Design Patterns and Bloch's
Effective Java.

Regards,

- Yagiz Erkan -
